content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-039-05-B |Item_parent=Medical assistance for procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Item_parent_short=Medical assistance in procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the frequency of recourse to MAP in France |Description=None |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors=Patricia Fauque,Fabrice Guerif,Charlotte Sonigo,Geoffroy Robin,Pierre-Emmanuel Bouet,Stéphanie Huberlant,Nathalie Rives |Order=5}} '''Around 1 in 4 to 6 couples''' seek help for infertility in France today. In 2021, according to figures from the Agence de la Biomédecine, there will be : - just over 48,000 IUI attempts - just over 62,000 oocyte retrievals with a view to IVF +/- ICSI - just over 28,000 births after MAP, i.e. ''3.7% of births in France''.

question.question: Around what percentage of births in France are the result of MAP (Medical Assistance for Procreation)?
